targets.expr: sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Dota_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Dota_1"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Dota_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Dota_1"})

sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Dota_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Dota_2"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Dota_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Dota_2"})

sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_SC_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_SC_1"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_SC_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_SC_1"})

sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_SC_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_SC_2"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_SC_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_SC_2"})

sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Else_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Else_1"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Else_1", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Else_1"})

sum(rate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Else_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[10s])) by (mode)* 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Else_2"}) or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance="BI_Else_2", mode!="idle", mode!="iowait"}[5m])) by (mode) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="user", instance="BI_Else_2"})

alert.name: BI_Dota_1 MySQL Client Thread Activity alert

panels.description:
**Peak Threads Connected**  is number of peak number of connections MySQL had in the period of time

**Peak Threads Running** is the peak number of threads considered "Running" by MySQL, not Sleeping or Waiting on Table level locks which can be indicative for workload spikes

**Avg Threads Running** is the average number of Threads running over interval which can be indicative of sustained load
panels.title: BI_Dota_1 MySQL Client Thread Activity
